author: Special Correspondent
text:
The process of forwarding interest-free financial assistance to small traders under Amma Micro Loan Scheme was initiated by State Environment Minister Thoppu N.D. Venkatachalam at the Netaji Market on Tuesday.

Loans to the tune of Rs.1.1 crore have been forwarded through the 33 branches of Central Cooperative Bank to 2,206 beneficiaries, the Minister said. The scheme devised by the State Government for small traders who had lost livelihood due to the flood envisages forwarding of a maximum of Rs. 5,000 loan to street vendors, petty shops and sellers of flowers, fruits and vegetables. The loan could be repaid in easy instalments of Rs. 200 per week for 25 weeks.

Collector S. Prabakar, Mayor Malliga Paramasivam, took part in the event. Those who return the loan promptly will be entitled to further loan at four per cent interest, the Minister said.

The scheme was devised by the State Government for small traders who lost livelihood in the flood
title: Micro loan scheme for small traders launched in Erode
